article.title: Organic molecules, ions, and rare isotopologues in the remnant of the stellar-merger candidate, CK Vulpeculae (Nova 1670)

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the red circle on the map represent?
choices: The beam of APEX at 690 GHz.
The beam of APEX at 345 GHz and IRAM at 145 GHz.
The beam of IRAM at 230 GHz.
The beam of APEX at 810 GHz.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the green line in the figure?
choices: To indicate the location of strong emission lines.
To show the atmospheric transparency at the APEX site.
To mark the rms levels achieved by IRAM.
To represent the spectral coverage of the data collected with IRAM.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following molecules is NOT listed as having identified rare isotopologues?
What is the estimated 16O/18O ratio in CK Vul, as indicated in the table?
